_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Farm Product Raw Material Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan - Executive Summary

Facility:    AGChoice
Location:    9197 NE 50th St., Weir, Ks. 
Contact:      Bill Garner
Phone:     620-396-8554


1. The Facility Policy

AGChoice and the employees of the AGChoice Ammonia Plant near Weir are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the Cherokee Township Fire Department, and other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.

2. Facility Information

The primary activity at the facility is the receiving, storage and distribution of anhydrous ammonia for direct application as a crop nutrient.

The facility has two 30,000 gallon, one 18,000 gallon and one 12,000 gallon storage tanks and (11) 1,000 gallon nurse tanks and (11) 1,450 gallon nurse tanks for product distribution. The maximum quantity handled would be the unloading of a transport delivery truck holding approximately 50,000 pounds. 

3. The Accidental Release Prevention Program.

The facility is working to implement the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1, 1989", published by The American National Standards Institute, Inc., and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and handling of Anhydrous Ammonia", and the Kansas Fertilizer Law.

4. The Five-year Accident History

There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused any deaths or injuries.

5. The Emergency Response Program.

The facility has;

    a. a written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA
       Standard, 29 CFR 1910.38;

    b. provided State and Local authorities with the emergency
       planning and community right-to-know information as
       required under SARA Title III (EPCRA);

    c. a written emergency response program, in accordance with
       OSHA Standard

, 29 CFR 1910.120, including pre-emergency
       planning and employee training.

6. Planned changes to improve safety.

Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility. Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions. There are no additional specific anhydrous ammonia safety recommendations for implementation at this time.



    4/13/10
